segment.source: The Application Compatibility Toolkit (ACT) Community uses the Microsoft® Compatibility Exchange to share compatibility ratings between all registered ACT Community members.
segment.target: The Application Compatibility Toolkit (ACT) Community uses the Microsoft® Compatibility Exchange to share compatibility ratings between all registered ACT Community members.

segment.source: The Application Compatibility Toolkit (ACT) Community uses the Microsoft® Compatibility Exchange to share compatibility ratings between all registered ACT Community members.
segment.target: The Application Compatibility Toolkit (ACT) Community uses the Microsoft® Compatibility Exchange to share compatibility ratings between all registered ACT Community members.

segment.source: When you access the Microsoft Compatibility Exchange as a registered ACT Community member, you can upload your compatibility data to the community and download issues from other ACT Community members.
segment.target: When you access the Microsoft Compatibility Exchange as a registered ACT Community member, you can upload your compatibility data to the community and download issues from other ACT Community members.

segment.source: For information about how compatibility ratings are entered, see Selecting Your Compatibility Rating.
segment.target: For information about how compatibility ratings are entered, see Selecting Your Compatibility Rating.

segment.source: ACT takes your information and combines it with all of the information provided by the other ACT Community users and shows the average rating as a color gradient from one to five bars.
segment.target: ACT takes your information and combines it with all of the information provided by the other ACT Community users and shows the average rating as a color gradient from one to five bars.

segment.source: The following diagram shows the process for synchronizing compatibility ratings with the ACT Community.
segment.target: The following diagram shows the process for synchronizing compatibility ratings with the ACT Community.

segment.source: You have the option to exclude applications from being shared with the Microsoft Compatibility Exchange.
segment.target: You have the option to exclude applications from being shared with the Microsoft Compatibility Exchange.

segment.source: However, you will not get compatibility ratings from the ACT Community for any application that you exclude.
segment.target: However, you will not get compatibility ratings from the ACT Community for any application that you exclude.

segment.source: For more information, see Sending and Receiving Compatibility Data.
segment.target: For more information, see Sending and Receiving Compatibility Data.
